001package io.github.ai4ci.abm;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004
005import org.immutables.value.Value;
006
007import it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.IntIntImmutableSortedPair;
008
009/**
010 * Represents a weighted social relationship (an edge) between two individuals
011 * in the simulation's social network. This immutable value object stores the
012 * strength of the relationship and the identifiers of the two people involved.
013 * It provides methods to calculate the probability of contact based on
014 * individual mobility and to retrieve the associated {@link Person} objects.
015 * This class is {@link Serializable} for persistence.
016 */
017@Value.Immutable
018public interface SocialRelationship extends Serializable {
019        /**
020         * Calculates the probability of a contact occurring between the two
021         * individuals in this relationship, adjusted by their respective mobility
022         * factors. The calculation is
023         * {@code getRelationshipStrength() * adjMobility1 * adjMobility2}.
024         *
025         * @param adjMobility1 The adjusted mobility factor of the first participant.
026         * @param adjMobility2 The adjusted mobility factor of the second
027         *                     participant.
028         * @return The probability of contact, a double value.
029         */
030        public default double contactProbability(
031                        double adjMobility1, double adjMobility2
032        ) {
033                return this.getRelationshipStrength() * adjMobility1 * adjMobility2;
034        }
035
036        /**
037         * Returns an immutable sorted pair of integer IDs representing the two
038         * individuals involved in this social relationship. The IDs are sorted to
039         * ensure that the relationship is uniquely identified regardless of the
040         * order of participants.
041         *
042         * @return An {@link IntIntImmutableSortedPair} containing the IDs of the two
043         *         people.
044         */
045        IntIntImmutableSortedPair getPeopleIds();
046
047        /**
048         * The significance or strength of the relationship, expressed as a
049         * probability or quantile. This value represents the likelihood that a
050         * contact will occur between two maximally mobile participants. A value
051         * close to 1 indicates a strong, close relationship with a high probability
052         * of contact, while a value near 0 signifies an improbable or weak
053         * connection.
054         *
055         * @return The strength of the social relationship, a double between 0 and 1.
056         */
057        double getRelationshipStrength();
058
059        /**
060         * Retrieves the {@link Person} object corresponding to the source (first)
061         * individual in this relationship. The source is determined by the first ID
062         * in the {@link #getPeopleIds() sorted pair}.
063         *
064         * @param outbreak The {@link Outbreak} instance from which to retrieve the
065         *                 person.
066         * @return The {@link Person} object for the source individual.
067         * @throws java.util.NoSuchElementException if the person with the source ID
068         *                                          is not found in the outbreak.
069         */
070        default public Person getSource(Outbreak outbreak) {
071                return outbreak.getPersonById(this.getPeopleIds().firstInt())
072                                .orElseThrow();
073        }
074
075        /**
076         * Retrieves the {@link Person} object corresponding to the target (second)
077         * individual in this relationship. The target is determined by the second ID
078         * in the {@link #getPeopleIds() sorted pair}.
079         *
080         * @param outbreak The {@link Outbreak} instance from which to retrieve the
081         *                 person.
082         * @return The {@link Person} object for the target individual.
083         * @throws java.util.NoSuchElementException if the person with the target ID
084         *                                          is not found in the outbreak.
085         */
086        default public Person getTarget(Outbreak outbreak) {
087                return outbreak.getPersonById(this.getPeopleIds().secondInt())
088                                .orElseThrow();
089        }
090
091}
